Css.description: CSS or Cascading Style Sheets is the language used to style the frontend of any website. CSS is a cornerstone technology of the World Wide Web, alongside HTML and JavaScript.Visit the following resources to learn more:

resources.name: CSS Crash Course For Absolute Beginners
CSS Masterclass - Tutorial & Course for Beginners
cssreference.io: All CSS properties at a glance
Joshw Comeaus CSS Hack Blog Posts

questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
questions.description: Choose the correct expansion for the acronym CSS.

options.label: A
options.description: Counter Style Sheet
options.explanation: Incorrect. This is not the correct expansion for CSS.

options.label: B
options.description: Cascading Style Sheet
options.explanation: Correct! CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheet.

options.label: C
options.description: Computer Style Sheet
options.explanation: Incorrect. This is not the correct expansion for CSS.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of CSS?
questions.description: Select the option that best describes the main role of CSS in web development.

options.label: A
options.description: Handling server-side logic
options.explanation: Incorrect. CSS is primarily used for styling and presentation, not server-side logic.

options.label: B
options.description: Managing databases
options.explanation: Incorrect. CSS is not involved in managing databases.

options.label: C
options.description: Styling and formatting web pages
options.explanation: Correct! CSS is used to style and format the visual presentation of web pages.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to link an external CSS file?
questions.description: Select the HTML tag commonly used to link an external CSS file to an HTML document.

options.label: A
options.description: <style>
options.explanation: Incorrect. The <style> tag is used for internal CSS, not for linking external CSS files.

options.label: B
options.description: <link>
options.explanation: Correct! The <link> tag is used to link an external CSS file to an HTML document.

options.label: C
options.description: <script>
options.explanation: Incorrect. The <script> tag is used for JavaScript, not for linking CSS files.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the CSS property 'color'?
questions.description: Choose the correct description of the 'color' property in CSS.

options.label: A
options.description: Setting the background color of an element
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'color' property is used to set the text color, not the background color.

options.label: B
options.description: Defining the font style
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'color' property is specifically for text color, not font style.

options.label: C
options.description: Setting the text color of an element
options.explanation: Correct! The 'color' property is used to set the text color of an HTML element.

questions.question: What does the term 'CSS Selector' refer to?
questions.description: Choose the correct definition for the term 'CSS Selector'.

options.label: A
options.description: A programming language in CSS
options.explanation: Incorrect. CSS Selector is not a programming language.

options.label: B
options.description: A pattern used to select and style HTML elements
options.explanation: Correct! A CSS Selector is a pattern used to select and style HTML elements.

options.label: C
options.description: A file format for storing CSS styles
options.explanation: Incorrect. CSS Selector is not a file format.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to add space outside an element's border?
questions.description: Select the CSS property that is used to add space outside the border of an element.

options.label: A
options.description: padding
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'padding' adds space inside the element's border.

options.label: B
options.description: margin
options.explanation: Correct! 'margin' adds space outside the element's border.

options.label: C
options.description: border
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'border' is used to define the element's border.

questions.question: What is the default value of the 'position' property in CSS?
questions.description: Choose the default value for the 'position' property if not specified.

options.label: A
options.description: static
options.explanation: Correct! 'static' is the default value for the 'position' property in CSS.

options.label: B
options.description: relative
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'relative' is not the default value for the 'position' property.

options.label: C
options.description: absolute
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'absolute' is not the default value for the 'position' property.

questions.question: What does the 'CSS Box Model' describe?
questions.description: Select the correct description for the 'CSS Box Model'.

options.label: A
options.description: A model for organizing CSS files
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'CSS Box Model' is not related to organizing CSS files.

options.label: B
options.description: A model for defining the layout of HTML elements
options.explanation: Correct! The 'CSS Box Model' describes how HTML elements are rendered as boxes with content, padding, border, and margin.

options.label: C
options.description: A model for handling CSS animations
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'CSS Box Model' is not specifically related to CSS animations.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to control the transparency of an element?
questions.description: Select the CSS property that is used to control how transparent an element is.

options.label: A
options.description: opacity
options.explanation: Correct! The 'opacity' property is used to control the transparency of an element.

options.label: B
options.description: visibility
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'visibility' property controls whether an element is visible or hidden but not its transparency.

options.label: C
options.description: background-color
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'background-color' sets the background color but does not control transparency.

questions.question: What does the 'CSS Flexbox' layout model aim to solve?
questions.description: Choose the problem that the 'CSS Flexbox' layout model aims to address.

options.label: A
options.description: Responsive design for various screen sizes
options.explanation: Incorrect. Responsive design is addressed by media queries, not specifically by the 'CSS Flexbox' layout model.

options.label: B
options.description: Vertical centering of elements
options.explanation: Correct! 'CSS Flexbox' is designed to simplify the vertical and horizontal alignment of elements.

options.label: C
options.description: Managing CSS animations and transitions
options.explanation: Incorrect. CSS animations and transitions are separate concepts from the 'CSS Flexbox' layout model.

questions.question: What does the 'CSS Box Model' consist of?
questions.description: Choose the components that make up the 'CSS Box Model'.

options.label: A
options.description: Content, padding, border, margin
options.explanation: Correct! The 'CSS Box Model' consists of content, padding, border, and margin.

options.label: B
options.description: Header, footer, sidebar
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'CSS Box Model' components are related to the layout and spacing of elements, not specific regions like header or footer.

options.label: C
options.description: Variables, mixins, extends
options.explanation: Incorrect. These terms are more associated with preprocessor languages like Sass, not the 'CSS Box Model'.

questions.question: What does the 'float' property in CSS do?
questions.description: Select the effect of the 'float' property in CSS.

options.label: A
options.description: Changes the text color
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'float' property is not related to text color changes.

options.label: B
options.description: Specifies the positioning of an element
options.explanation: Incorrect. Although 'float' affects positioning, it's not the primary purpose of this property.

options.label: C
options.description: Allows an element to be pushed to one side and float around its container
options.explanation: Correct! The 'float' property allows an element to be pushed to one side and float around its container.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to set the font size of text?
questions.description: Select the CSS property commonly used to control the size of text.

options.label: A
options.description: font-weight
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'font-weight' is used to set the thickness of characters, not the size.

options.label: B
options.description: font-style
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'font-style' is used to set the style (italic, oblique) of the font, not the size.

options.label: C
options.description: font-size
options.explanation: Correct! 'font-size' is used to set the size of the font in CSS.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'display' property in CSS?
questions.description: Choose the role of the 'display' property in CSS.

options.label: A
options.description: Changing the background color of an element
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'display' is not used for changing the background color.

options.label: B
options.description: Controlling how elements are rendered in the layout
options.explanation: Correct! 'display' is used to control how elements are rendered in the layout.

options.label: C
options.description: Setting the width of an element
options.explanation: Incorrect. Width is controlled by the 'width' property, not 'display'.

questions.question: What does the 'z-index' property in CSS control?
questions.description: Choose the aspect of the layout that the 'z-index' property influences.

options.label: A
options.description: Text alignment
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'z-index' is not related to text alignment.

options.label: B
options.description: Positioning in the z-axis (stacking order)
options.explanation: Correct! 'z-index' controls the stacking order of positioned elements along the z-axis.

options.label: C
options.description: Border thickness
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'border' properties control the thickness of an element's border, not 'z-index'.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'media query' in CSS?
questions.description: Select the role of a 'media query' in CSS.

options.label: A
options.description: Controlling animation speed
options.explanation: Incorrect. Animation speed is not controlled by media queries.

options.label: B
options.description: Applying styles based on the characteristics of the device or screen
options.explanation: Correct! Media queries are used to apply styles based on device or screen characteristics.

options.label: C
options.description: Adjusting font size
options.explanation: Font size adjustments are typically done using other CSS properties, not media queries.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used for creating rounded corners?
questions.description: Choose the CSS property that is commonly used to create rounded corners.

options.label: A
options.description: border-style
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'border-style' defines the style of the border, not the corner shape.

options.label: B
options.description: border-radius
options.explanation: Correct! 'border-radius' is used to create rounded corners.

options.label: C
options.description: border-width
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'border-width' sets the width of the border, not the corner shape.

questions.question: What does the 'transition' property in CSS enable?
questions.description: Select the effect that the 'transition' property allows in CSS.

options.label: A
options.description: Creating 3D effects
options.explanation: Incorrect. 3D effects are more related to transforms, not transitions.

options.label: B
options.description: Animating changes to CSS properties
options.explanation: Correct! 'transition' enables smooth animations of changes to CSS properties.

options.label: C
options.description: Applying shadows to elements
options.explanation: Incorrect. Shadows are typically controlled by the 'box-shadow' property, not 'transition'.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'position' property in CSS?
questions.description: Choose the role of the 'position' property in CSS.

options.label: A
options.description: Setting font properties
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'position' property is not used for setting font properties.

options.label: B
options.description: Controlling the layout and positioning of elements
options.explanation: Correct! The 'position' property is used to control the layout and positioning of elements in CSS.

options.label: C
options.description: Applying color to text
options.explanation: Applying color is typically done using the 'color' property, not 'position'.

questions.question: What does the 'box-sizing' property in CSS control?
questions.description: Select the aspect of the box model that 'box-sizing' influences.

options.label: A
options.description: Border thickness
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'box-sizing' does not control the thickness of the border.

options.label: B
options.description: Box model calculation, including or excluding padding and border
options.explanation: Correct! 'box-sizing' controls whether the box model calculation includes or excludes padding and border.

options.label: C
options.description: Element visibility
options.explanation: Element visibility is not controlled by 'box-sizing'.

questions.question: Explain the difference between 'display: block' and 'display: inline' in CSS.
questions.description: Provide a distinction between the 'display' values 'block' and 'inline'.

options.label: A
options.description: Both 'block' and 'inline' elements are identical in their behavior.
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'block' and 'inline' elements have distinct behavior in the layout.

options.label: B
options.description: 'block' elements stack vertically, taking up the full width, while 'inline' elements flow horizontally, taking up only as much width as necessary.
options.explanation: Correct! This accurately describes the difference between 'block' and 'inline' elements.

options.label: C
options.description: 'block' and 'inline' elements both stack horizontally, but 'block' elements are typically used for inline text.
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'block' elements stack vertically, and 'inline' elements flow horizontally.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'position: absolute' property in CSS?
questions.description: Explain the behavior of the 'position: absolute' property.

options.label: A
options.description: It positions an element relative to its normal position in the document flow.
options.explanation: Correct! 'position: absolute' positions an element relative to its nearest positioned ancestor or the initial containing block.

options.label: B
options.description: It removes an element from the document flow, causing it to be ignored in the layout.
options.explanation: Incorrect. This describes the behavior of 'position: fixed' rather than 'position: absolute'.

options.label: C
options.description: It makes an element float to the left or right of its container.
options.explanation: Incorrect. Floating is controlled by the 'float' property, not 'position: absolute'.

questions.question: Explain the purpose of the 'flexbox' layout in CSS.
questions.description: Describe the role of the 'flexbox' layout model in CSS.

options.label: A
options.description: It is used for creating animations and transitions.
options.explanation: Incorrect. Animations and transitions are not the primary purpose of the 'flexbox' layout model.

options.label: B
options.description: It provides a one-dimensional layout for items in a container, distributing space along a single axis.
options.explanation: Correct! 'flexbox' is designed for one-dimensional layouts, distributing space along either the horizontal or vertical axis.

options.label: C
options.description: It is specifically used for creating grid-based layouts.
options.explanation: Incorrect. Grid-based layouts are handled by the 'grid' layout model, not 'flexbox'.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'box-shadow' property in CSS?
questions.description: Explain the role of the 'box-shadow' property.

options.label: A
options.description: It adds a shadow to the text inside an element.
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'box-shadow' adds a shadow to the entire box of an element, not just the text inside it.

options.label: B
options.description: It creates a shadow behind an element's border box.
options.explanation: Correct! 'box-shadow' is used to create a shadow effect behind an element's border box.

options.label: C
options.description: It sets the shadow color for the text inside an element.
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'box-shadow' is not used to set the shadow color of text.

questions.question: What is the 'clearfix' technique in CSS used for?
questions.description: Explain the purpose of the 'clearfix' technique.

options.label: A
options.description: It is a technique for creating transparent elements.
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'clearfix' is not related to creating transparent elements.

options.label: B
options.description: It is used to clear the float property and prevent container collapse.
options.explanation: Correct! 'clearfix' is a technique to prevent the collapsing of a container when it contains floated elements.

options.label: C
options.description: It is a technique for centering elements horizontally and vertically.
options.explanation: Incorrect. Centering is achieved through other techniques, not 'clearfix'.

questions.question: What does the 'max-width' property in CSS control?
questions.description: Select the aspect of an element's sizing that 'max-width' influences.

options.label: A
options.description: It sets the maximum font size for an element.
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'max-width' does not control the maximum font size.

options.label: B
options.description: It sets the maximum width of an element.
options.explanation: Correct! 'max-width' controls the maximum width an element can have.

options.label: C
options.description: It specifies the maximum number of lines of text in an element.
options.explanation: The number of lines is not controlled by 'max-width'.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'nth-child' selector in CSS?
questions.description: Explain the role of the 'nth-child' selector in CSS.

options.label: A
options.description: It selects elements based on their order within a parent.
options.explanation: Correct! 'nth-child' selects elements based on their position within a parent element.

options.label: B
options.description: It selects only the first child element of a parent.
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'nth-child' can select elements beyond the first child.

options.label: C
options.description: It is used to style elements with specific classes.
options.explanation: Class-based styling is typically done with class selectors, not 'nth-child'.

questions.question: What does the 'content' property in CSS do?
questions.description: Choose the role of the 'content' property in CSS.

options.label: A
options.description: It sets the content of a pseudo-element.
options.explanation: Correct! 'content' is used to set the content of a pseudo-element generated by CSS.

options.label: B
options.description: It specifies the content of an HTML element.
options.explanation: 'content' does not specify the content of an HTML element but is used for pseudo-elements.

options.label: C
options.description: It controls the visibility of an element.
options.explanation: 'content' is not used for controlling visibility.

questions.question: Explain the 'box-sizing' property and its values in CSS.
questions.description: Provide an explanation of the 'box-sizing' property and its possible values.

options.label: A
options.description: 'box-sizing' controls the space inside an element and accepts values 'content-box' and 'border-box'.
options.explanation: Correct! 'box-sizing' controls how the total width and height of an element are calculated, and it can have values 'content-box' or 'border-box'.

options.label: B
options.description: 'box-sizing' sets the display type of an element and accepts values 'inline' and 'block'.
options.explanation: 'box-sizing' is not related to the display type of an element.

options.label: C
options.description: 'box-sizing' defines the positioning of an element and accepts values 'relative' and 'absolute'.
options.explanation: 'box-sizing' is not related to positioning; it's about the calculation of the box model.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'currentColor' keyword in CSS?
questions.description: Explain the role of the 'currentColor' keyword in CSS.

options.label: A
options.description: 'currentColor' sets the color of the element to the current browser default color.
options.explanation: 'currentColor' does not refer to the browser default color but inherits the color property of the element.

options.label: B
options.description: 'currentColor' sets the color of an element to the computed value of the 'color' property.
options.explanation: Correct! 'currentColor' is a keyword that represents the computed value of the 'color' property of an element.

options.label: C
options.description: 'currentColor' defines a gradient with colors transitioning from the current color to transparent.
options.explanation: 'currentColor' is not used to define gradients; it represents the computed color of the element.

questions.question: Explain the 'grid' layout in CSS and its key properties.
questions.description: Provide an overview of the 'grid' layout model and mention key properties associated with it.

options.label: A
options.description: The 'grid' layout is used for one-dimensional layouts and has properties like 'grid-template-columns' and 'grid-template-rows'.
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'grid' layout is two-dimensional and includes properties like 'grid-template-columns' and 'grid-template-rows'.

options.label: B
options.description: The 'grid' layout is used for two-dimensional layouts and includes properties like 'grid-template-columns' and 'grid-template-rows'.
options.explanation: Correct! The 'grid' layout is designed for two-dimensional layouts with properties like 'grid-template-columns' and 'grid-template-rows'.

options.label: C
options.description: The 'grid' layout is a simplified version of the 'flexbox' model.
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'grid' and 'flexbox' serve different purposes; 'grid' is not a simplified version of 'flexbox'.

questions.question: Describe the role of the 'position: sticky' property in CSS.
questions.description: Explain how the 'position: sticky' property works and its use cases.

options.label: A
options.description: 'position: sticky' positions an element relative to its nearest positioned ancestor.
options.explanation: 'position: sticky' actually positions an element based on the user's scroll position and toggles between 'relative' and 'fixed'.

options.label: B
options.description: 'position: sticky' positions an element based on the user's scroll position and is often used for headers or sidebars.
options.explanation: Correct! 'position: sticky' is used to create elements that are positioned based on the user's scroll and is commonly used for headers or sidebars.

options.label: C
options.description: 'position: sticky' is a shorthand for 'position: static' and has no practical use.
options.explanation: 'position: sticky' has a specific purpose and is not a shorthand for 'position: static'.

questions.question: Explain the 'clip-path' property in CSS and its applications.
questions.description: Provide an overview of the 'clip-path' property and how it can be used.

options.label: A
options.description: 'clip-path' is used to create rounded corners on elements.
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'clip-path' is not primarily used for creating rounded corners.

options.label: B
options.description: 'clip-path' is used to define a clipping region for an element and can be applied with various shapes.
options.explanation: Correct! 'clip-path' is used to define a clipping region for an element, and it supports various shapes like circles and polygons.

options.label: C
options.description: 'clip-path' is a property for creating drop shadows on elements.
options.explanation: Creating drop shadows is typically done with the 'box-shadow' property, not 'clip-path'.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'will-change' property in CSS?
questions.description: Explain the role of the 'will-change' property and its impact on browser performance.

options.label: A
options.description: 'will-change' is used to animate elements smoothly and is recommended for every animated property.
options.explanation: 'will-change' is not recommended for every animated property; it's used to hint to the browser which properties are likely to change.

options.label: B
options.description: 'will-change' is used to hint to the browser that an element is about to change, potentially improving performance.
options.explanation: Correct! 'will-change' is used to provide a hint to the browser that an element is likely to change, optimizing performance.

options.label: C
options.description: 'will-change' is a shorthand for setting multiple CSS properties at once.
options.explanation: 'will-change' is not a shorthand for setting multiple properties; it's used for optimization.

questions.question: Explain the 'CSS variables' feature and how they differ from traditional variables in programming languages.
questions.description: Provide an overview of CSS variables and highlight their differences from variables in traditional programming languages.

options.label: A
options.description: CSS variables are used for storing values, similar to variables in programming languages, and can be reassigned dynamically.
options.explanation: Correct! CSS variables store values and can be reassigned dynamically, but they work differently from variables in traditional programming languages.

options.label: B
options.description: CSS variables are only used for color values and cannot be reassigned.
options.explanation: Incorrect. CSS variables can be used for various types of values, not just colors, and can be reassigned.

options.label: C
options.description: CSS variables are not supported in modern browsers, and their use is discouraged.
options.explanation: This statement is incorrect; CSS variables are widely supported in modern browsers.

questions.question: Describe the 'transform' property in CSS and its applications.
questions.description: Provide an overview of the 'transform' property and mention common use cases.

options.label: A
options.description: 'transform' is used to change the font size of text elements.
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'transform' is not used to change the font size but to apply transformations like scaling and rotating.

options.label: B
options.description: 'transform' is used for 3D animations and is applicable only to elements with the 'position: absolute' property.
options.explanation: 'transform' can be used for 3D transformations, but it is not limited to elements with 'position: absolute'.

options.label: C
options.description: 'transform' is used to apply 2D and 3D transformations to elements, such as scaling and rotating.
options.explanation: Correct! 'transform' can be used for both 2D and 3D transformations, including scaling, rotating, and more.

questions.question: Explain the 'object-fit' property in CSS and its use cases.
questions.description: Provide an overview of the 'object-fit' property and mention scenarios where it is useful.

options.label: A
options.description: 'object-fit' is used to control the positioning of background images.
options.explanation: 'object-fit' is used for controlling how an replaced element's content (e.g., an image) is fit into its box, not for background images.

options.label: B
options.description: 'object-fit' is used to define the size and positioning of an element within its container, such as an image or video.
options.explanation: Correct! 'object-fit' defines how an element's content should be resized and positioned within its box.

options.label: C
options.description: 'object-fit' is a property for styling form elements like checkboxes and radio buttons.
options.explanation: Styling form elements is typically done with other properties, not 'object-fit'.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'counter' and 'content' properties in CSS?
questions.description: Explain how the 'counter' and 'content' properties are used together in CSS.

options.label: A
options.description: 'counter' is used to create counters in CSS, and 'content' is used to set the content of pseudo-elements.
options.explanation: Correct! 'counter' is used for creating counters, and 'content' is used to set the content of generated pseudo-elements.

options.label: B
options.description: 'counter' and 'content' are used to define the font style and size of text within an element.
options.explanation: Styling text is typically done with other properties, not 'counter' and 'content'.

options.label: C
options.description: 'counter' and 'content' are used to create animated transitions between different sections of a webpage.
options.explanation: Creating animated transitions is typically done with animation properties, not 'counter' and 'content'.

questions.question: Explain the 'z-index' property in CSS and how it affects the stacking order of elements.
questions.description: Provide an overview of the 'z-index' property and its impact on the stacking order of elements.

options.label: A
options.description: 'z-index' is used to set the vertical position of an element and is primarily applied to flex items.
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'z-index' is not about setting the vertical position but rather the stacking order, and it's not limited to flex items.

options.label: B
options.description: 'z-index' is used to control the stacking order of elements, with higher values bringing elements to the front.
options.explanation: Correct! 'z-index' controls the stacking order of elements, and higher values bring elements closer to the front.

options.label: C
options.description: 'z-index' is a property for adjusting the spacing between elements in a layout.
options.explanation: 'z-index' is not used for adjusting spacing but for controlling the stacking order of elements.

questions.question: Describe the 'aspect-ratio' property in CSS and its applications.
questions.description: Provide an overview of the 'aspect-ratio' property and mention scenarios where it can be useful.

options.label: A
options.description: 'aspect-ratio' is used for defining the aspect ratio of images in CSS.
options.explanation: 'aspect-ratio' is not specifically used for images but for specifying the aspect ratio of boxes and containers.

options.label: B
options.description: 'aspect-ratio' is used to enforce a specific aspect ratio on an element, helping maintain proportions in responsive designs.
options.explanation: Correct! 'aspect-ratio' is used to enforce a specific aspect ratio on an element, aiding in maintaining proportions in responsive designs.

options.label: C
options.description: 'aspect-ratio' is a property for controlling the spacing between elements in a layout.
options.explanation: Spacing between elements is typically controlled by other properties, not 'aspect-ratio'.

questions.question: Explain the 'contain' property in CSS and its role in layout optimization.
questions.description: Provide an overview of the 'contain' property and how it contributes to layout optimization.

options.label: A
options.description: 'contain' is used to set the width and height of an element in relation to its containing element.
options.explanation: 'contain' does not set the width and height of an element; it's related to layout containment and optimization.

options.label: B
options.description: 'contain' is a property for controlling how a box should be painted in relation to the layout of other boxes.
options.explanation: Correct! 'contain' is used for layout containment, optimizing rendering by isolating the box's layout.

options.label: C
options.description: 'contain' is a shorthand for multiple layout-related properties in CSS.
options.explanation: 'contain' is not a shorthand; it's a specific property for layout containment.

questions.question: Describe the 'aspect-ratio' property in CSS and how it differs from setting the width and height directly.
